conclusion: Use the formula for magnetic flux: Φ = B · A · cos(θ).
Define B as magnetic induction intensity, A as area of the coil, θ as angle between magnetic field vector and normal to the plane of the coil.
Initially, the coil is in the position shown in Picture 1.
Calculate cosine of initial angle: cos(30°) = √3/2.
Calculate initial magnetic flux: Φ_initial = 0.01√3 Wb.
After rotating 60°, angle remains 30° in opposite direction.
Cosine of final angle remains: cos(30°) = √3/2.
Calculate final magnetic flux: Φ_final = 0.01√3 Wb.
Determine change in magnetic flux: ΔΦ = Φ_final - Φ_initial = 0.
The change in magnetic flux is 0.
